intro: Commelina aspera var. aspera, commonly known as rough commelina, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that are clustered in umbels, often surrounded by white bracts. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
